Reference/API¶

sbfit.image¶

This module defines classes of images that read from FITS files.

class sbfit.image.BkgImage(image, norm_keyword='bkgnorm', norm_type='count', extension=0)[source]¶

Bases: sbfit.image.Image

Parameters

  • image (str or HDU) – The image to be loaded.

  • norm_keyword (str, optional) – The keyword of scaling factor in the header. The default norm_keyword = “bkgnorm”.

  • norm_type ({"count", "flux"}, optional) – The type of the background scaling factor. “count” : the ratio between the total background count number in the count image and that in the background image. “flux” : the ratio between the total background count rate in the count image and that in the background image. For the “flux” type, the exposure time of the background image need to be properly provided. The default norm_type = “count”.

  • extension (int, optional) – The number of the hdu that contains the image data. The default extension = 0.

Notes

There are two types of normalisation:

One is a ratio between counts rates. In this case we need additional information from exposure time. Another one is a ratio between counts numbers.

property bkgnorm¶
property exptime¶
property norm_type¶
class sbfit.image.CtsImage(image, extension=0)[source]¶

Bases: sbfit.image.Image

The count image class.

Parameters

  • image (str or HDU) – The image to be loaded.

  • extension (int, optional) – The number of the hdu that contains the image data. The default extension = 0.

class sbfit.image.ExpImage(image, extension=0)[source]¶

Bases: sbfit.image.Image

The exposure map class.

Parameters

  • image (str or HDU) – The image to be loaded.

  • extension (int, optional) – The number of the hdu that contains the image data. The default extension = 0.

property unit¶

The unit of the exposure map.

sbfit.model¶

This module defines classes of surface brightness profile models.

class sbfit.model.Beta(norm=1.0, beta=1.0, r=1.0, **kwargs)¶

Beta profile.

Parameters

  • x (number) – The input number for calculation.

  • norm (number) – The normalization at the center of the cluster.

  • beta (number) – The beta parameter.

  • r (number) – The core radius.

References

Cavaliere, A. & Fusco-Femiano, R. 1976, A&A, 500, 95

class sbfit.model.ConeDoublePowerLaw(norm=1, a1=0, a2=1.0, phi_b=10.0, c=2.0, r1=0.5, r2=1.0, phi_max=70, center=0, redshift=0.1, **kwargs)¶
Parameters

  • x –

  • norm (number) – The electron density after the break (cm^-3).

  • a1 –

  • a2 –

  • phi_b –

  • c –

  • r1 (float) – Inner radius of the sector (arcsec).

  • r2 (float) – Outer radius of the sector (arcsec).

  • phi_max –

  • center –

  • redshift (float) – redshift.

class sbfit.model.Constant(norm=0.0, **kwargs)¶

Constant model.

Parameters

  • x (number or np.ndarray) – The input number for calculation.

  • norm (float) – The output constant.

class sbfit.model.DoublePowerLaw(norm=1, a1=0.1, a2=1.0, r=1.0, c=2.0, **kwargs)¶

Projected double power law profile.

Parameters

  • x (number) – The input number for calculation.

  • norm (number) – The density normalization at the jump.

  • a1 (number) – The power law index of the density profile before the jump.

  • a2 (number) – The power law index of the density profile after the jump.

  • r (number) – The jump location.

  • c (number) – The strength of the jump, i.e., the contraction factor.

Notes

x, r have a unit of arcsec; n has an arbitrary unit.

References

Owers et al. 2009, ApJ, 704, 1349.

class sbfit.model.Gaussian(norm=1, x0=0, sigma=1, **kwargs)¶

Gaussian profile model.

Parameters

  • x (number or np.ndarray) – The input number for calculation.

  • norm (number) – The normalization at the peak.

  • x0 (number) – The center of the Gaussian profile.

  • sigma (number) – The width of the profile.

sbfit.model.custom_model(func)[source]¶

Model class decorator. An alternative version of astropy.modeling.custom_model.

sbfit.observation¶

This module includes observation classes.

class sbfit.observation.Observation(cts_image_file, exp_image_file, bkg_image_file, bkg_norm_type='count', bkg_norm_keyword='bkgnorm', extension=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class of a single observation, which contains a count map, an exposure map, and a background map.

Parameters

  • cts_image_file (str) – The count image of the observation.

  • exp_image_file (str) – The exposure map of the observation.

  • bkg_image_file (str) – The image that represents the background level of the observation.

  • bkg_norm_type ({"count", "flux"}, optional) – The type of the background scaling factor. “count” : the ratio between the total background count number in the count image and that in the background image. “flux” : the ratio between the total background count rate in the count image and that in the background image. For the “flux” type, the exposure time of the background image need to be properly provided. The default norm_type = “count”.

  • bkg_norm_keyword (str, optional) – The keyword of scaling factor in the background image header. The default norm_keyword = “bkgnorm”.

  • extension (int, optional) – The number of the hdu that contains the image data. The default extension = 0.

property bkg_image¶

The background image.

property cts_image¶

The count image.

property exp_image¶

The exposure map.

property exposure_unit¶

The unit of the exposure map.

property instrument¶

The instrument by which the observation was performed.

property pixel_scale¶

The pixel scale of the FITS images.

property telescope¶

The telescope by which the observation was performed.

class sbfit.observation.ObservationList(obs_list=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class that contains all individual observations of an object that from the same instrument.

Parameters

obs_list (list, optional) – The list of observations to be combined. The default obs_list = None.

Notes

All individual observations must have the same pixel scale and exposure map unit.

Add a new observation object into the current observation list.

Parameters

new_observation (Observation) – The new observation.

add_observation_from_file(cts_image_file, exp_image_file, bkg_image_file, bkg_norm_type='count', bkg_norm_keyword='bkgnorm', extension=0)[source]¶

Load a new observation from FITS files and add it into the current observation list.

Parameters

  • cts_image_file (str) – The count image of the observation.

  • exp_image_file (str) – The exposure map of the observation.

  • bkg_image_file (str) – The image that represents the background level of the observation.

  • bkg_norm_type ({"count", "flux"}, optional) – The type of the background scaling factor. “count” : the ratio between the total background count number in the count image and that in the background image. “flux” : the ratio between the total background count rate in the count image and that in the background image. For the “flux” type, the exposure time of the background image need to be properly provided. The default norm_type = “count”.

  • bkg_norm_keyword (str, optional) – The keyword of scaling factor in the background image header. The default norm_keyword = “bkgnorm”.

  • extension (int, optional) – The number of the hdu that contains the image data. The default extension = 0.

Notes

The exposure_unit attribute will be updated.

See also

Observation

The unit of the exposure map.

sbfit.profile¶

This module defines the profile class.

class sbfit.profile.Profile(raw_data: astropy.table.table.Table, channel_width=1, channel_start=0, pixel_scale=0.01, exposure_unit=Unit('s'), profile_axis='x')[source]¶

Bases: object

The Profile class.

Parameters

  • raw_data (Table) – The raw table of data of individual pixels.

  • channel_width (number, optional) – The width of each channel, which is the minimum unresolved size. The default channel_width = 1 arcsec.

  • pixel_scale (number, optional) – The image pixel scale. The default pixel_scale = 0.01 degree.

  • exposure_unit (Unit, optional) – The unit of the exposure map. The default exposure_unit = s.

  • profile_axis ({"x", "y"}, optional) – The type of the profile. “x”: radial profile with x-axis unit of arcsec. “y”: azimuthal profile with x-axis unit of degree.

property binned_profile¶

The binned surface brightness profile.

calculate(update=True)[source]¶

Calculate the C-statistic value for the current model.

Parameters

update (bool, optional) – Update the model profile, default = True.

Returns

stat_value – The calculated C-statistic value.

Return type

float

property channel_width¶

The width of each channel. A channel is the smallest discrete element of the profile.

property error¶

The error estimated by the MCMC method.

fit(show_step=False, show_result=True, record_fit=True, tolerance=0.01)[source]¶

Fit binned profile with the model.

Parameters

  • show_step (bool, optional) – Whether show C-statistic value of each fit step.

  • show_result (bool, optional) – Whether show fit result.

  • record_fit (bool, optional) – Whether record the fit result in the Profile object.

  • tolerance (float, optional) – Tolerance to terminate the fit iteration.

Returns

stat – The best-fit C-statistic value.

Return type

float

mcmc_error(nsteps=5000, nwalkers=32, burnin=500)[source]¶

To estimate the errors by using the MCMC method in the emcee package.

Parameters

  • nsteps (int, optional) – The steps of the MCMC chain. The default nsteps = 5000.

  • nwalkers (int, optional) – The number of MCMC walkers. The default nwalkers = 32.

  • burnin (int, optional) – The number of steps at the beginning of the chain, which should be discarded when estimating the errors.

See also

emcee

https://emcee.readthedocs.io/en/stable/

property mcmc_flat_samples¶
property model¶

The model of the profile.

plot(plot_type='profile', scale='loglog', xlim=None, ylim=None)[source]¶

To show different types of data.

Parameters

  • plot_type ({"profile", "mcmc_chain", "contour"}, optional) – Types of plot. “profile” : The binned surface brightness profile. “mcmc_chain” : The MCMC chain of each free parameter after estimating the errors. “contour” : The “corner” plot of free parameters after estimating the errors. The default plot_type = “profile”.

  • scale ({"loglog", "semilogx", "semilogy", "linear"}, optional) – The X-Y axis scale of the profile plot. The default scale = “loglog”.

  • xlim (tuple, optional) – The X-axis limits of the profile.

  • ylim (tuple, optional) – The Y-axis limits of the profile.

rebin(start, end, method='min_cts', min_cts=30, lin_width=10, log_width=0.05)[source]¶

Rebin the profile from the raw profile.

Parameters

  • start (float) – Start point of the profile.

  • end (float) – End point of the profile. Depending on different methods, the actual boundary of the last bin can be different from this value.

  • method ({"min_cts", "lin", "log"}, optional) – The method to bin the profile. “min_cts” : each bin has at least a certain number of counts. “lin” : each bin has the same width. “log” : each bin has the same width in the logarithmic space. The default method = “min_cts”.

  • min_cts (int, optional) – The minimum count number in each of the bins. Used if method == “min_cts”. The default min_cts = 30.

  • lin_width (float, optional) – The width of each bin. Used if method == “lin_width”. The default lin_width = 10 arcsec.

  • log_width (float, optional) – The width of each bin in the logarithmic space, in unit of dex. Used if method == “log_width”. The default log_width = 0.05.

set_model(model: astropy.modeling.core.Model)[source]¶

Set model for the Profile object.

Parameters

model (Model) – The model used for fit.

set_smooth_matrix(kernel_type, sigma=1, king_rc=4, king_alpha=1.4, custom_kernel=None)[source]¶

Set the smoothing matrix for the profile to account for the PSF of the telescope.

Parameters

  • kernel_type ({"identity", "gaussian", "king", "custom"}) – Type of the PSF kernel. “identity”: Identity matrix. “gaussian”: Gaussian profile. “king”: King profile. “custom”: User defined kernel. The default kernel_type = “identity”.

  • sigma (number, optional) – The sigma of Gaussian kernel. The default sigma = 1 arcsec.

  • king_rc (number, optional) – The core radius of the king profile.

  • king_alpha (number, optional) – The power law index of the king profile. The default king_alpha=1.4.

  • custom_kernel (Kernel, optional) – The customized smoothing kernel.

update_mcmc_flat_sample(burnin)[source]¶

Update the flat MCMC sample with a new burn-in steps value.

Parameters

burnin (int) – The number of steps at the beginning of the chain, which should be discarded when estimating the errors.

sbfit.region¶

This module defines all supported DS9 region classes.

Regions are classified as inclusive regions and exclusive regions. Inclusive regions are used for defining the profile extraction region shape and direction, while exclusive regions are used to mask out contaminated pixels. Inclusive regions are “Panda”, “Epanda”, and “Projection”. Exclusive regions are “Circle” and “Ellipse”.

Currently, the supported coordinate frames are “fk5”, “icrs”, and “image”.

class sbfit.region.Circle[source]¶

Bases: sbfit.region.ExcludeRegion

class sbfit.region.ExcludeRegion[source]¶

Bases: sbfit.region.Region

The base class of all exclusive regions.

mask(imgdata, header=None)[source]¶
Parameters

  • imgdata (ndarray) – The input image array based on which the exclusion mask is defined.

  • header (fits.Header) – The FITS header of the input image, which is used for convert sky coordinate to the image coordinate.

Returns

mask – The calculated mask.

Return type

ndarray

class sbfit.region.IncludeRegion[source]¶

Bases: sbfit.region.Region

The base class of all inclusive regions.

get_x_coordinate(imgdata, header=None, axis='x')[source]¶

For a given image, calculate the X coordinate on the profile for each pixel. Meanwhile, an inclusive mask based on the region shape is calculated.

Parameters

  • imgdata (ndarray) – The input image array to calculate X, Y coordinate based on the extraction region.

  • header (fits.Header) – The FITS header of the input image, which is used for convert sky coordinate to the image coordinate.

  • axis ({"x", "y"}, optional) – The extracted profile direction. “X”: azimuthally averaged radial profile. “Y”: radially averaged azimuthal profile (only supported by Panda).

Returns

  • profile_xcoor (ndarray) – Calculated X coordinate of each pixel.

  • profile_mask (ndarray) – The include mask of the region.

class sbfit.region.RegionList(frame='fk5')[source]¶

Bases: object

This is a container of a number of region objects. The RegionList object can have one inclusive region and multiple exclusive regions.

Parameters

frame ({"fk5", "icrs", "image"}, optional) – The image coordinate frame of the regions. The default frame = “fk5”.
